init.title: Hub Configuration
init.description: Configure options for this Emergency Alerts hub.

global_options.title: Global Emergency Alerts Settings
global_options.description: Configure global settings that apply to all Emergency Alerts.

data_description.default_escalation_time: Default time in seconds before alerts escalate if not acknowledged (60-3600 seconds)
data_description.enable_global_notifications: Send notifications for all emergency alerts using the global service
data_description.global_notification_service: Service to use for global notifications (e.g., 'notify.notify' or 'notify.mobile_app_phone')
data_description.global_notification_message: Template for global notification messages. Available variables: {alert_name}, {severity}, {group}, {entity_id}

group_options.title: Manage Alerts
group_options.description: Choose an action to manage alerts in this group. Currently {alert_count} alert(s) configured.

add_alert.title: ‚ûï Add New Alert
add_alert.description: Configure your emergency alert with all options on one page.

data_description.name: A descriptive name for this alert (e.g., 'Front Door Open', 'High Temperature')
data_description.trigger_type: Simple: Monitor one entity's state. Template: Use Jinja2 for complex conditions.
data_description.severity: Critical: Urgent issues. Warning: Important but not critical. Info: General notifications.
data_description.entity_id: The Home Assistant entity to monitor (e.g., binary_sensor.front_door, sensor.temperature)
data_description.trigger_state: State that triggers the alert. Examples: 'on' for binary sensors, 'unavailable' for offline devices, '30' for numeric thresholds
data_description.template: Jinja2 template that returns True when alert should trigger. Example: states('sensor.temperature')|float > 25 would return True when temperature exceeds 25. Test templates in Developer Tools > Template before using.
data_description.on_triggered_script: Optional script to run when this alert triggers. Create scripts in Settings > Automations & Scenes > Scripts.

remove_alert.description: Select an alert to remove from this group.
